content.question: A student recorded the rate of decomposition of compound <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></math> as a function of time at <math alttext="45 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45</mn><mi>Â°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The experimental data are shown above. What is the rate law for the decomposition of <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></math> at this temperature?

choices.label: Rate <math alttext="equals k times the molar concentration of A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>A</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Rate <math alttext="equals k times the molar concentration of A, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>A</mtext><msup><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
The rate law cannot be determined without additional experimentation.

content.answer: Rate <math alttext="equals k times the molar concentration of A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>A</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
